column2: On second thought suspect `registerOnTypeFormattingEditProvider` might do what I want. Will report back :rose:

With regards to error-lists, showing long error messages completely would occupy space. So, I am thinking to provide an expand/collapse option for the error-entry to show or hide the complete description.

This feature helps us because I often want to use "Add Selection" (`Ctrl+D`) while continuing the "Find". When I am using "Find" `foo` to check whether all `foo`s were written correctly, I found incorrect `bar`. I selected `bar` and pressed `Ctrl+D`, to fix the `bar`. Then, the "Find" text box was changed to `bar` unintentionally. I have to type `foo` again into the "Find" text box to continue the checking.
Is this platform dependant? Finder, in OS X, does not behave that way.
I install back to 1.1.1, everything is ok.

You can bind any key/keys to the `acceptSelectedSuggestion` command using the keyboard configuration story. For details see: https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/customization/keybindings#_customizing-shortcuts

@clarkcox3 You can get this behaviour for page up and page down by editing the `keybindings.json`:  ``` { "key": "pagedown", "command": "scrollPageDown", "when": "editorTextFocus" }, { "key": "pageup", "command": "scrollPageUp", "when": "editorTextFocus" } ```  I don't think we have commands that scroll to the beginning/end of the document that you can easily bind to.

@githubhero What theme are you using? What you describe sounds like the Dark (Visual Studio) theme. If you like variable and function declaration highlighted, use the Dark+ theme.  If that's not the problem, please add a code snippet that shows the issue.

When opening vscode, the file tsconfig.json is opend in vscode editor. After executing _F1 > 6282: Stat File System_ all directories of my workspace are scanned. In the command prompt where codeHelper is running no ouptput happens. After executing _F1 > 6282: Install Watchers_, file watchers for all files in the root directory are getting istalled (see attached file output_6282.zip).  Until this time there is still no output on to see in the codeHelper command prompt. But when I open a .ts  file in vscode editor _watcher notified events_ are fired for each file in project workspace until vscode hangs and has to be killed. At the same time (when opening a .ts file) codeHelper also generates output. The attached file contains the output of the 6282 console of vscode at the time after opening a ts file in editor, but before vscode hangs. [output_6282.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/302062/output_6282.zip)

Workaround:   1) Create a file named `/usr/local/bin/bash-login` (or whatever you'd like to name it) and add the following lines to it (You might need root to create that file depending on your setup):  ``` bash #!/bin/bash bash -l ```  2) Make it executable with `chmod +x /usr/local/bin/bash-login`.  3) On your VSCode user settings, set:  ``` JSON {   "terminal.integrated.shell.linux": "/usr/local/bin/bash-login" } ```  4) Profit âœ¨   ![](https://cldup.com/6lQPeaCwcJ.png)

After thinking again, I think its not a good idea to put owner information as part of the entry as not everybody is interested in this info. Another idea is to put it as part of the filters so that interested users can filter markers based on who generate them

I agree with @RyanEwen. I really appriciate the open development and amount of communication, but these announcements being  part of the official "Release Notes" is really confusing.  Maybe this can be split up into actual release notes, and 'what we're working on right now' or something.

@frogcjn what do you mean by 'Sourcemap section'?  VS Code supports source maps, including inlined source maps and inlined source.  VS Code does **not** support 'index maps' (see https://docs.google.com/document/d/1U1RGAehQwRypUTovF1KRlpiOFze0b-_2gc6fAH0KY0k/edit?hl=en_US)

@weinand ReactNative generate source map v3, with a sections property, then vscode cannot match with this kind of source map. Vscode only can debug with source code without sections. chrome supports debug with source map sections.

You can get the selection `Range` with `document.getSelection().getRangeAt(0)`.  You could then extract the client rects that form it via: `range.getClientRects()`, and create a lot of absolutely positioned white divs of the right sizes with `mix-blend-mode: difference;`. That way they reverse whatever is below them.  Would also need to use `pointer-events: none` on the divs so that they don't affect the selection.
@coreh if adding the `-l` arg is all there is to it then this should make it into the next release in the form of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7266

Shouldn't we not try to address this issue by starting to consolidate the two Terminal types in VS Code first?  I propose to have only one "Terminal" in VS Code. This can be either opened from the Explorer's "Open in Terminal" action (which does a 'cd' to the selected folder) or with a global "Open Terminal" action (which opens the terminal at the project root).  Whether this Terminal is a 'System Terminal' or the 'Integrated Terminal' can be controlled via a setting.

I've actually already done this as part of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/7288  Using `::selection`, I take the `color` and make it the selection `background-color`, then with the make the `background-color` the selection `color`. It turned out really nicely:  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/15850995/cc2db92a-2c4f-11e6-95cf-8855fc38fe61.png)

In the following snippet, I want to highlight: - <?php and ?> - file_get_contents - json_decode - trim - strtolower - file_exists - fopen - fwrite - fclose - in_array - header - unset  ``` <?php  $content = file_get_contents('php://input'); $update = json_decode($content, true);  $text = trim($text); $text = strtolower($text);  $filePath = 'jvm/jsm.json';  switch ($text) {     case '/start':      if (file_exists($filePath)) {         // found         $string = file_get_contents($filePath);         $obj = json_decode($string, true);         $ids = $obj['ids'];      if (in_array($chatId, $ids)) {             header('Content-Type: application/json');             $parameters = array('chat_id' => $chatId, 'text' => 'running');             $parameters['method'] = 'sendMessage';             echo json_encode($parameters);         }         else {             $ids[] = $chatId;             $a = array('ids' => $ids);             $fp = fopen($filePath, 'w');             fwrite($fp, json_encode($a));             fclose($fp);              header('Content-Type: application/json');             $parameters = array('chat_id' => $chatId, 'text' => 'Avviato');             $parameters['method'] = 'sendMessage';             echo json_encode($parameters);         }     }     else {         // not found                    $a = array('ids' => array($chatId));         $fp = fopen($filePath, 'w');         fwrite($fp, json_encode($a));         fclose($fp);          header('Content-Type: application/json');         $parameters = array('chat_id' => $chatId, 'text' => 'ok');         $parameters['method'] = 'sendMessage';         echo json_encode($parameters);     }     ;     break;     case '/stop':            if (file_exists('jvm/jvm.json')) {          $string = file_get_contents($filePath);         $obj = json_decode($string, true);         $ids = $obj['ids'];         if (in_array($chatId, $ids)) {              unset($ids[array_search($chatId, $ids)]);             $a = array('ids' => $ids);             $fp = fopen($filePath, 'w');             fwrite($fp, json_encode($a));             fclose($fp);          }         else{              // cut...          }      }     // cut... }  ?> ```  ``` ```

@magnasteyr thanks for trying. I created a new version of the extension that reads the content of all js and ts files. Although this usually shouldn't trigger change events it might since a read updates the last read time on Windows. So could you uninstall that last version of the 6282 extension, install the new attached version and run F1 > 6282: Read Contents with the CodeHelper running as well. Lets hope that we see file events now. Then we at least know what is happening.  [6282-0.0.1.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/302141/6282-0.0.1.zip)

@sandy081 sorry, I was not clear in my description. Corrected it. I was talking about the source attribute on a marker. And be aware that different markers on a file can have different source attibutes. So we can't make it part of the file name. Either we need a column or we integrate it into the message as we do in hovers (e.g [ts]. [js], ...)

This should be fixed now, it happened because stable was built using some changes in vscode-distro that I wasn't expecting. I created https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7308 to follow this up in the June release so this doesn't happen in the real switch over to tar.xz.

Actually the action fixes all auto-fixable problems as defined by eslint (see http://eslint.org/docs/rules/). The action is clear in the UI, but not in the command name since the name sounded very long. We will update the documentation to explain this.  There is nothing VS Code can do since the rule is not auto fixable in eslint itself. Closing the issue.
The new version of 6282 extension is missing...

Is it really that the case sensitive button just isn't discoverable or is it that the need to set case sensitivity is unexpected? It does seem odd to have to turn case sensitivity on when the expression explicitly specifies a case.  Perhaps we just disable the case sensitive toggle whenever the user specifies a regex pattern? Or, we do a tooltip indicating when case sensitivity is turned off whenever the user toggles regex on?

@alexandrudima  Thanks for your reply. in the system whit Chinese language ,the   **ctrl+space** usually switch the English and Chinese input by default. In the last win10 ,I even can't change the short key.SO I define a vs code setting file.it works.

So, this helped: - Reinstall VSCode - Reinstall node  ---  I had a problem with node versions.  I've used node v5.\* in a system, while local version from /usr/local/bin/node -v v4.4.5  So, VSCode was using v4.4.5, and I could not change it in settings, so I've removed a link from usr/local/bin catalog. And it was using v5 as a default for some time. But after update to a new VSCode version it started to throw an ENOENT error (as in title).  And this inconsistency in versions were preventing me to debug a project due to sass-package, build with other node version  ``` ".../node-sass/vendor/darwin-x64-46/binding.node" exists.   testing binary. Binary is fine; exiting. ```  So, it is a bit complicated :) Anyway, I think, there should be something improved I guess :)
@aeschli Martin, I updated to 1.2.0 right now and, aside from <?php and ?>, it looks like it is working now.  Anyway, I have the same issue with JavaScript and C# files too.

Hey... I just erased all the old installations and did a fresh install and that fixed the issue. Sorry for the confusion, last time when I did yum install vscode it updated the rpm. The yum installation is successful but not updating the actual files that could be the reason am seeing the old version in help menu and all the errors. I don't have the old rpm to install and try updating to the new one to test it.  This is fixed. Thanks for your time!

@Tyriar I'm so used to the `âŒ˜K` shortcut to clear the terminal on Mac, that I do it automatically without thinking. And I do it a lot.  The `âŒ˜K` combination is even recognised in the Chrome DevTools Console for clearing the output - yet another reason that I'm so used to it.  I realise I may not be alone in this, so I have a suggestion: - As per your suggestion, set the default "Clear Terminal" shortcut to something that won't conflict with another shortcut, especially the chord keybindings. - If the user decides to override the default shortcut with `âŒ˜K`, make sure that VSCode does not consider that as initiation of a chord keybinding.  This way, there won't be a conflict by default, but the user can opt to lose chord keybindings when in the context of the terminal, in favour of using the well-recognised shortcut.  Would you mind to reopen the issue to make it easier to find, and to continue the discussion?
The task frameworks sets cwd to the workspace folder by default if not provided. So I don't understand why setting it explicitly makes it work. Need to investigate.

You tried to use this extension (https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=robinbentley.sass-indented)?

Yeah, we [cut](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/contrib/referenceSearch/browser/referencesModel.ts#L84) the left part of a preview to roughly eight characters and prefer word boundaries, such as `.`, `-`, whitespace etc. I see how this isn't right for css. Maybe we shouldn't use `/\b/` but a custom set of splitters

I am very sorry to hear you are having issues with VS Code. I wonder if this issue is being caused by an installed extension. Can you try to run VS Code without extensions? From the command line, execute: `code --disable-extensions` and try your steps again to see if it reproduces. If you see it is an issue with the extension, please file it against the extension repository itself.
